channel.title: Where to find combat animations?
channel.description:
Hey there guys, looking for some information.
I want to fix the fact that no NPC's have combat/death animations in the source I am working with (entrinthy, by the way). I know about the NPC file that tells the server which animations to use, but I don't know what it is referencing for the numbers. Some are still -1 and whatnot, and the NPC's just stand there while attacking.
Can anyone point me to the right files that list the animations, or do I need to get a Cache Editor and pull things apart to find them?
ps - 718 source

item.title: Where to find combat animations?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“krizmac, post:1, topic:547590”]Hey there guys, looking for some information.

I want to fix the fact that no NPC’s have combat/death animations in the source I am working with (entrinthy, by the way). I know about the NPC file that tells the server which animations to use, but I don’t know what it is referencing for the numbers. Some are still -1 and whatnot, and the NPC’s just stand there while attacking.

Can anyone point me to the right files that list the animations, or do I need to get a Cache Editor and pull things apart to find them?

ps - 718 source[/quote]

Chances are you’ll probably have to just test animations until you get the right one. I suppose you could make a command and keep trying them all out until you find the one that works. But I don’t think there is a map that tells you what animations go to what skeleton. Because it does use a skeleton system, any entity can perform any animation. Perhaps with strange results, but it’s still valid.

Read full topic
